snippet: The president-elect, Enrique Peña Nieto, will need to resist a return to the past and deliver on his promise for reform and transparency.
abstract: Editorial questions whether Mexico's Pres-elect Enrique Pena Nieto can separate himself from the Institutional Revolutionary Party's corrupt old guard and take on the near-monopolies that backed his party's return to power after 12 years; asserts that Pena Nieto has a chance to restore his party's reputation and do a lot of goof for Mexico if he can deliver on his promises to make reforms, increase accountability and end the bloodshed.
lead_paragraph: The president-elect, Enrique Peña Nieto, will need to resist a return to the past and deliver on his promise for reform and transparency.
